bibl.title: Letter from C.S. Gray to Thomas C. Lazear and Charles P. Orr, February 29, 1904

div1.p: Gray requests Mabel Lazear's opinion regarding an offer to purchase Lazear property in Pittsburgh.

div1.head: Letter from C.S. Gray to Thomas C. Lazear and Charles P. Orr, February 29, 1904
div1.opener:
Lazear and Orr.
St. Nicholas Building.
Pittsburgh, Pa.
THOS. C. LAZEAR,
CHAS. P. O.P.R.
JESSE, T. LAZEAR.
Pittsburg, Pa., Feb'y 29th, 1904.
Lazear & Orr, Esqs.,
St. Nicholas Bldg.,
C I T Y.
Dear Sirs:-
div1.p:
We have an offer for the Lazear property on Frankstown Avenue near
Penn of $28,000. $10,000. cash and the balance secured by Bond and
mortgage at 5% interest, which I think it advisable for us to consider.

Taking the damages allowed by the City for the frontage taken in
the widening of Frankstown Avenue, which I understand is an asset of the
estate, makes the entire consideration about $35,000., which in my opinion
is not far from the full value of the property.

This sale will be subject to a commission of %2 to Mr. W. L. Stewart
the agent who makes the offer.

If you think the price is sufficient, I would be obliged to you if
you would submit it to Mrs. Lazear for her opinion. I have promised to
give the purchaser an answer within ten days and you will greatly oblige
me if you will act promptly.
div1.closer:
Yours truly, C. S. Gray,
Trust Officer.
